intro: Haplopappus cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pappus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical herbaceous growth habit. The plant features linear, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is typically found in dry, well-drained habitats.
